name: Hymns I Grew Up With Online Quiz | Hymns and Sacred Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Amazing Grace how sweet the sound that saved a __________ like me." 

What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
wretch.

	"Amazing Grace" was written by John Newton. According to the "Dictionary of American Hymnology" "Amazing Grace" was an autobiographical song.

questions.text:
"Holy, holy, holy merciful and mighty God in ________ persons, blessed Trinity." 

What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
three.

	"Holy, Holy, Holy" was written by Reginald Heber. This song was used in the 1997 movie "Titanic".

questions.text:
"When I in awesome wonder consider all thy _______ thy hands hath made." 

What goes in this blank?
questions.explanation:
works.

	"How Great Thou Art" was originally a Swedish tune written by Carl Gustav Boberg. It was translated into English by Stuart K. Hine. "How Great Thou Art" was made popular by George Beverly Shea and Cliff Barrows during the Billy Graham Crusades.

questions.text: "Joyful, joyful we adore thee God of glory, Lord of ________" what?
questions.explanation:
love.

	The music to "Joyful Joyful We Adore Thee" is "Ode to Joy" by Beethoven. The words were a poem written by poet Henry Van Dyke.

questions.text:
"When peace like a river attendeth my way, when sorrows like sea billows roll. Whatever my _______ thou has taught me to say." 

What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
lot.

	"It is Well With My Soul" was composed by Phillip Bliss and the words were written by Horatio Spafford. Spafford wrote this song in regards to all his tragedies: losing his only child, the Chicago Fire of 1871 where he lost a lot of money he had invested, business trouble and other things.

mine.

	"Blessed Assurance" lyrics were written by a blind woman named Fanny J. Crosby in 1973. The same year Phoebe K. Knapp wrote the music.

questions.text:
"On hill far away stood an old rugged cross, the emblem of suffering and shame. And I _________ that old cross..." 

What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
love.

	"The Old Rugged Cross" was written in 1912 by George Bennard. It is very popular with not only Christian artists, but country artists as well.

questions.text:
"What a ____________ we have in Jesus all our sins and griefs to bear!" 

What goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
friend.

	Joseph M. Scriven originally wrote "What a Friend We Have in Jesus" for his mother to comfort her. The music was written several years later by Charles C. Converse.

questions.text:
"I come to the garden alone, while the dew is still on the ____________". 

What flower goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
roses.

	"In the Garden" (also known as "I Come to the Garden Alone") was written by C. Austin Miles. Words from this song can be found on Louisiana's 45th governor, Earl Long's gravestone. It was his favorite song.

questions.text:
"I'd rather have Jesus than silver or gold; I'd rather be his than have riches untold; I'd rather have Jesus than ____________ or lands" 

What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
houses.

	"I'd Rather Have Jesus" was written by George Beverly Shea. Shea was a longtime singer at the Billy Graham Crusades. In 2013, Shea passed away from a stroke at the young age of 104.
